400.message: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

401.message: The request contained valid data and was understood by the server, but the server is refusing action. This may be due to the user not having the necessary permissions for a resource or needing an account of some sort, or attempting a prohibited action. The request should not be repeated.

403.message: The request contained valid data and was understood by the server, but the server is refusing action. This may be due to the user not having the necessary permissions for a resource or needing an account of some sort, or attempting a prohibited action. The request should not be repeated.

404.message: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future. Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.

cnt.title: Countries
cnt.instruction: An identifier of a Country is part of the UID generated or registered.

pts.title: Participants
pts.instruction: An identifier of a Participant is part of the UID generated or registered.

ptt.title: Participant Types
ptt.instruction: An identifier of a Participant Type is part of the UID generated or registered.

sta.title: States
sta.instruction: An identifier of a State is part of the UID generated or registered.

typ.title: Types
typ.instruction: An identifier of an Account Type is part of the UID generated or registered.

uid.title: Identifier
uid.instruction: A UID unequivocally identifies the person responsible for a query or a data change across all services. The UID does not contain any personally identifiable data. An assignment to the person can only be made with the participation of the participant.
